subject: RE: [junit] testing junit
messageBody:
JUnit Cookbook:
http://www.junit.org/junit/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm

JUnit Primer:
http://www.clarkware.com/articles/JUnitPrimer.html


--- Andrew Zou <azou@...> wrote:
> Could you please tell me the correct "URL" for it?
>
> Andrew
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Yahoo [mailto:bujinwang@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 4:07 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] testing junit
>
>
> Actually it is working. Just the link to it doesn't work.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Andrew Zou <mailto:azou@...>
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com' <mailto:'junit@yahoogroups.com'>
> Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:06 AM
> Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit
>
> I think this link(
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm
> <http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm> ) does not
> work any
> more. Does any body know the mirror site or they moved this page to
> where.
>
> Thanks.
>
> Andrew
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Philippe Vanpeperstraete
> [mailto:philippe.vanpeperstraete@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:48 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit
>
>
> Did you look under the "documentation" tab, there, you'll find the
> JUnit
> cookbook, which is a pretty good start, if you get your Java
> environment
> straight.
>
> regards
> Philippe
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ram Kumar [mailto:y_ramkumar@...]
> Sent: woensdag 30 mei 2001 16:33
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] testing junit
>
>
>
> Hi,
>
> I am a new JUnit user and just downloaded JUnit and trying to work
> with it.
> I could not find proper documentation about how to install JUnit and
> use it,
> in JUnit site.
>
> Could any one suggest me where to find good documentation about
> JUnit?
>
> Awaiting your immediate reply.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Yamasani.
>
>
